      JExpress.Response status(int status)
      Set the HTTP status of the response
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the current response.

      Appends the specified value to the HTTP response header field.
      Parameters:
      field - a header field name
      value - the value of the header field
      Returns:
      the current response.

    • json

      void json(Object object) throws IOException
      Sends a JSON response with the correct 'Content-Type'.
      Parameters:
      object - an object, can be an iterable, a stream, a record or a map
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • json

      void json(String json) throws IOException
      Sends a JSON response with the correct 'Content-Type'.
      Parameters:
      json - a JSON string
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • send

      void send(String body) throws IOException
      Send a Text response. If the status is not defined 200 will be used. If the Content-Type is not defined, "text/html" will be used.
      Parameters:
      body - the text of the response
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • sendFile

      void sendFile(Path path) throws IOException
      Send a file as response. The status is set to 200 if the file is found or 404 if not found.
      Parameters:
      path - the path of the file;
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
